sub_topic: Determining the volume of a sphere.
message_1: A sphere has a radius of 5 cm. Find its volume, rounding your answer to the nearest whole number.
message_2:
The formula to find the volume of a sphere is V = (4/3)πr^3, where V is the volume and r is the radius.

Given the radius r = 5 cm, we can plug this value into the formula:

V = (4/3)π(5)^3
V = (4/3)π(125)
V ≈ 523.6 cubic centimeters

Rounding to the nearest whole number, the volume of the sphere is approximately 524 cubic centimeters.
